item.content:encoded:
Ok, since some things are apparently being overlooked (and/or ignored if they were unclear).

1st: Probability
Probability for the first day obvious requires that the number to win must be 10880 or higher (11001-121 = 10880).
No surprise.

2nd: "Day" here might be someone misleading. This is assuming that someone wins each day, and/or that the number of entries is until the next person wins. That is, "day" here refers to the same game.

3rd: The probability calculated is based upon winning at least once. So "day 1" = 11 entries (121), thus 121/11000 = 0.011 (No surprise). From this, we have the probability of not winning day 1, which is 1-0.011 or 0.989.

However, day 2 is calculated by 1 - Not winning day 2 Given not winning day 1.
Thus 1 - (0.989 * 0.989) = 1 - (0.989^2) = 0.021879 = 2.1879% which rounds up on the table. Keep in mind, this is assuming a new game each day in this case.

Day 3's probability (3rd game, and not on the same day as game 1 and game 2) = 1 - (Probability not winnning game 3 * prob not winning game 2 * prob not winning game 1) = 1 - (0.989^3) = 1 - 0.967361669 = 0.032638331 = 3.2638331 %. Which after rounding comes to 3.26%

Same thing for 22 entries per day (which means 22 entries are purchased on the same day, and ONLY those 22 entries in 1 game, no new game during those entries).

I'd recommend this page be deleted as the current numbers are completely off.

FYI.

121/11000 is your chance the first day.

Assuming the winner doesn't change your chance when you play the 2nd day is 242/11000 for a true chance or 121/10989 for a probability on that push alone.

when winner changes your chance all starts over.

many factors are missing from these very wrong Calculations and this game is by far not determined in a manner that using any of this system would really matter.

There fore I'd hope this page gets removed.
